subject: p14295224
History: Year old man with hx esophagectomy for esophageal cancer, severe GERD, aspiration pneumonia, R-sided rhonchi and crackles, recurrent aspiration PNA, please evaluate for R sided pneumonia.
Findings: The patient has had prior esophagectomy with a gastric pull-through. A new right lower lobe airspace opacity is likely due to aspiration pneumonia. The left lung is clear. There is no pneumothorax. Cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable.
Impression: New right lower lobe aspiration pneumonia.
